glsa.title: curl: NTLM response buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: curl is vulnerable to a buffer overflow which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: curl is a command line tool for transferring files via many different protocols.

description.p: curl fails to properly check boundaries when handling NTLM authentication.

impact.p: With a malicious server an attacker could send a carefully crafted NTLM response to a connecting client leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running curl.

workaround.p: Disable NTLM authentication by not using the --anyauth or --ntlm options.

resolution.p: All curl users should upgrade to the latest version:
